Articles.Content:
Soon, im going to do the Jool 5 challenge, but i have never landed something on one of Jools Moons, and i also never walked a kerbal on another planet. It is going to be hard, so i am doing this slowly. The first phase is going to be training and testing, here are my plans:

- Do a Rendezvous around the Mun. (Done, Succes)

- Do a an Ike sample return mission. (Done, Partial Succes)

- Build a space station. (Done)

- Build a Hugh Mungus rocket (Cancelled)

Those are the things i will do just to become more of a pro, otherwise the Jool 5 mission are going to be pretty clunky.

Phase 2 is actually working on the Jool 5 challenge. I will be building and testing the vehicles that will be landing on the Moons. Here are the things i will do:

-Build a small Laythe SSTO plane

-Build a Tylo Lander with mining system.

-Build a lander for all the other Moons.

-Build something that is gonna take this all to Jool.

I hope to see me doing this in just a week. So stay tuned. Phase 2 will be popping up next week on Monday hopefully.

Edited September 25, 2016 by NSEP

The Munar Orbit Rendezvous was great! Jebediah and Valentina went about 10 meters far away from each other. They also took a stop, to give the illusion they are standing still, so Jebediah could bang on Valentina's capsule, so he could feel a bit more Prankster Gangster. Valentina pooped her spacesuit. Jeb is now a top Prankster Gangster because he scare pranked somebody in space.

The Ike sample return did its job, it returned a sample from Ike back to Kerbin. But the return transfer did not end up well, their closest aproach was too far away, so they had to extend the mission 2 more years for another orbit, this makes the mission a partial succes. The return capsule shooted down at Kerbin at nearly 7km/s Luckily, the parachutes worked and the sample is now inside a secret locker in the R&D centre.

Edited September 25, 2016 by NSEP

The last task of Phase 1 has been completed, i scrapped the big rocket thing, there is no need for that now, so why would i even do it? The Station is small, but it has pretty much everything that a Space Station needs.

Holy cow! I just realized that i did 3/4 of all my planned tasks in 1 night! Not in 1 week! With that being done, phase 2 will be going up tommorow hopefully.
This is an ambitious mission for someone who hasn't gone anywhere but Duna and around the Kerbin system. Looking forward to the outcomes!
